title: 1. Set up the environment
text: This tutorial is intended for a pre-configured cloud environment, with a local setup as a fallback.

title: 1. Get started
text:
Goal
Access the workshop RStudio environment and verify that you can run R code.

title: 1. Get started
text:
Workshop environment
For this workshop, you will work in a pre-configured RStudio environment accessed via a web browser. No local installation is required.

title: 1. Get started
text:
Steps

1. Log in

Open the workshop login link
Sign in using your assigned username and password.



2. Check that R is running
In the Console tab in RStudio, run:
sessionInfo()

title: Import and analyse ASV portal data with R
text: This tutorial walks through the main steps needed to integrate ASV portal data in R and explore biodiversity patterns. As an example, we analyse microbial diversity along the Baltic Sea salinity gradient.

title: Import and analyse ASV portal data with R
section: Integration of ASV portal data with asvoccur
text:
Integration of ASV portal data with asvoccur

Get started — Access the workshop RStudio environment in PDC Cloud
Prepare data — Unpack, merge and aggregate example data sourced from the ASV portal

title: Import and analyse ASV portal data with R
section: Exploration of biodiversity patterns across environments
text:
Exploration of biodiversity patterns across environments

Prepare data — Load, merge and aggregate data sourced from the ASV portal
Map samples — Explore sampling coverage across season and salinity
Community structure — Bray–Curtis distances and PCoA across samples
Taxonomic composition — Taxonomic barplots across salinity basins

title: Exploring eDNA in SBDI
text: Welcome to the Exploring eDNA in SBDI workshop at SBDI Days 2026!

title: Exploring eDNA in SBDI
text:
Description
This workshop will demonstrate how environmental DNA (eDNA) / metabarcoding data can be accessed, processed, and analyzed within the Swedish Biodiversity Data Infrastructure (SBDI). We will show how to download eDNA data, use our R package to unpack, merge, and aggregate datasets, and then explore biodiversity patterns across environments in R. The session will also introduce SBDI resources for data submission, processing, and integration with GBIF.

title: Exploring eDNA in SBDI
text:
Expected outcomes
Participants will learn about tools and workflows for eDNA data management and analysis, and how these contribute to open biodiversity knowledge.

title: Exploring eDNA in SBDI
text:
Instructors

Prof. Anders Andersson — SBDI & KTH SciLifeLab
Dr. Daniel Lundin — SBDI & Linnaeus University
Dr. Maria Prager — SBDI & University of Gothenburg

title: Agenda
text:
10 February 2026, 16:00–17:30 William-Olsson lecture hall, Geoscience building, Stockholm University

Introduction (10 min)

Overview of SBDI and GBIF
eDNA tools and workflows in SBDI

From raw reads to ASVs (10 min)

Denoising and taxonomic annotation with nf-core/ampliseq

Data sharing and access in SBDI (10 min)

Metabarcoding data submission to ENA
Discovery, download, and submission in the ASV portal
Processing ASV portal downloads with asvoccur

Hands-on tutorial: Import and analyse ASV portal data with R (55 min)

Integrate ASV portal data with asvoccur
Explore biodiversity patterns across environments

Wrap-up (5 min)

Key takeaways
Support and next steps

title: Import and analyse ASV portal data with R
text:
Getting started

Set up the environment — Access the workshop RStudio environment (or run locally)

title: 1. Set up the environment
text:
Option A (recommended): Workshop RStudio environment
A virtual machine running RStudio Server is available in PDC Cloud. Log in using the credentials provided during the workshop:
RStudio Server
Follow the tutorial steps and avoid creating additional large objects, as resources are shared. Save your work regularly as an R script. The virtual machine will be shut down after the workshop, so download any code or output you want to keep via the Files pane (More → Export).

Check required packages
Load asvoccur and confirm version:
library(asvoccur)
packageVersion("asvoccur")  # Should say 1.1.1


Check access to example data
Example ASV portal data is available in a shared directory on the virtual machine. Check access:
data_path <- "/srv/course-data/16S"
list.files(data_path)
If two (16S) zip files are listed, you are ready to proceed.

title: 1. Set up the environment
section: Option B (fallback): Run RStudio locally on your laptop
text:
Option B (fallback): Run RStudio locally on your laptop
Our cloud environment is being tested for the first time. If needed, you can run the tutorial locally.
You will need to install:

R
RStudio
the remotes and asvoccur R packages

To install the required R packages:
install.packages('remotes')
remotes::install_github("biodiversitydata-se/asvoccur")
library(asvoccur)
packageVersion("asvoccur")  # Should say 1.1.1
In this option, example data is accessed via a shared Google Drive folder.
